lines.text: ...Well, I bet he wasn’t trying to set <c=#FF00FF>himself</c> on fire at all.
I mean, judging by the size of that ash pile, there was a lot more on fire than just the Go Wizard.
Since we know it can’t have been <c=#FF6000>Emergency Exit,</c> there had to be some other reason for the fire.
Considering how much damage it did, I’d bet there’s <c=#FF00FF>something else</c> the fire was supposed to burn up.
You think they’d start a fire like that just to destroy somethin’?
Why not flush it down the toilet? Feed it to the goat? Hide it in the trash heap?
Well, it could be something <c=#FF00FF>bigger</c> than they could dispose of like that…
Or maybe it just served a dual purpose- destroying whatever evidence he wanted destroyed, but also…
Making it <c=#FF00FF>look</c> like he tried to cast <c=#FF6000>Emergency Exit.</c>
This scene was set up to fool us into thinking they were <c=#FF00FF>level 2,</c> remember?
Hm. I’m not sure that’s the whole story, but…
Well, let’s tweak the question. It’s not ‘’why did he set himself on fire’’- it’s just ‘’why did they start a fire’’, period.
